title.narrative: Alliance 8.7 Accelerator Lab to Combat Modern Slavery

description.narrative:
The project aims at reducing the prevalence and the scope of modern slavery in the fisheries sector in Ghana, South Africa and Indonesia. The project will further accelerate the efforts towards the achievement of SDG 8.7 by governments, businesses and employers’ organisations, workers’ organisations and civil society organisations supporting persons vulnerable to recruitment into modern slavery.
The project will cover the start-up of the Alliance 8.7 Accelerator Lab to Combat Modern Slavery, and its operation during the first three years. The project proposes an integrated approach that expands the knowledge base and consolidates the evidence on successful experiences in addressing modern slavery to provide guidance to policy and intervention design. The establishment of the Accelerator Lab will enhance the catalysing function of Alliance 8.7, accelerating governments’ and organisations’ engagement, coordinating action, maximising partnerships, drive innovation and leverage resources to progress towards achievement of SDG 8.7. The Accelerator Lab will focus on the fishing supply chain, where the risk of modern slavery is particularly high and where cooperation across actors in indispensable given the complex cross border nature of this supply chain. The ILO estimates that more than 40 million people worldwide are victims of modern slavery, and women and girls are disproportionately affected accounting for 71 percent of the overall total. The ILO project will therefore apply a gender sensitive approach, in particular when addressing the issue of recruitment of fishing workers. By the end of the project, the Accelerator Lab will aim to show how to scale up solutions in the fisheries sector and collect evidence for the adoption of this experience to other sectors.
